body_html:
Hi @wt-huang,
thank you for your reply!
Sadly, this setting doesn't help. Note that the description of the setting says:

Enabling Win32 long paths will allow manifested win32 applications and Windows Store applications to access paths beyond the normal 260 character limit [...]

This suggests that it has to be enabled on application level. Maybe this helps (I have to admit that I have no idea about development on windows so I can't say if this is applicable).

body:
Hi @wt-huang,
thank you for your reply!
Sadly, this setting doesn't help. Note that the description of the setting says:
> Enabling Win32 long paths will allow manifested win32 applications and Windows Store applications to access paths beyond the normal 260 character limit [...]

This suggests that it has to be enabled on application level. Maybe [this](https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/50ecad58-b8cc-411a-af50-08a67dde5fca/long-name-support-is-not-enabled-on-windows-10?forum=windowssdk) helps (I have to admit that I have no idea about development on windows so I can't say if this is applicable).
